column4: I cannot mount my windows partition and I've tried all kinds of crap can someone please help me?
but the other partition isn't in there either and it mounts automatically
ok, so sda1 and sda2 are my windows drives... sda1 mounts np, sda2 has a problem
I've done that... but it's fat32 not ntfs :P
do you need to mirror all the packages too?
before you mount it run an fsck on it
the error is because you are trying to mount a partition which is only a container for the logical partition. you need to mount /dev/sda5 not /dev/sda3
youwere actually mounting /dev/sda2.. which appears to be the right part
ahh, no, i'm wrong again! it _is_ /dev/sda5 you should be mounting
imo, you should convert it to ext2/3 as that is also supported under windows with 3rd party softwar
might have to do update-pciids first
